00153 
00154    /* This covers both drivers: rgb133 and rgb200 */
00155    for(k=0; k<numCtrlDevices; k++)
00156    {
00157       /* Initialise structures */
00158       memset(&sysInfo, 0, sizeof(sysInfo));
00159       memset(&devInfo, 0, sizeof(devInfo));
00160       memset(&device, 0, sizeof(device));
00161 
00162       if(!fileExists(controlDevices[k][0]))
00163          continue;
00164       ctrlDevicesExist = 1;
00165 
00166       /* Open Vision / VisionLC Control device */
00167       fd = open(controlDevices[k][0], O_RDWR);
00168       if(fd == 0)
00169       {
00170          printf("Failed to open \"%s\"...\n", controlDevices[k][0]);
00171          return -1;
00172       }
00173 
00174       /* Open Vision / VisionLC Control device */
00175       if(readCtrlSystemInfo(fd, &sysInfo))
00176       {
00177          printf("Failed to read %s system info...\n", controlDevices[k][1]);
00178          close(fd);
00179          return -2;
00180       }
00181 
00182       printf("\n\nSystem has %d %s devices with a total of %d inputs...\n\n",
00183             sysInfo.devices, controlDevices[k][1], sysInfo.inputs);
00184 
00185       /* Open Vision / VisionLC Control device */
00186       for(i=0; i<sysInfo.devices; i++)
00187       {
00188          /* Set the device to be queried */
00189          devInfo.device = i;
00190          device.device = i;
00191          if(readDeviceInfo(fd, &devInfo))
00192             printf("Failed to read %s device[%d] info...\n", controlDevices[k][1], i);
00193          else
00194          {
00195             /* Get inputs for device[i] */
00196             for(j=0; j<devInfo.channels; j++)
00197             {
00198                /* Set the device's input to be queried */
00199                device.input = j;
00200 
00201                printf("%s Device[%.2d] Input[%.2d]: Name(%s)\n", controlDevices[k][1], i, j, devInfo.name);
00202                printf("                             Node(%s)\n", devInfo.node);
00203 
00204                /* Read data from selected device and input */
00205                if(readDeviceParms(fd, &device))
00206                   printf("Failed to read %s device[%d] parms...\n", controlDevices[k][1], i);
